channel.title: Problem adjusting parameters in patcher
channel.description:
I've encountered a problem with the Axoloti patcher which I have not seen before. I'm trying to run the Axoloti Patcher under Debian Wheezy (because that's what we use at work), building it from source.
I'm pretty sure I've tried this before with success, but now I get the odd behavior that when I point to a parameter dial and try to drag it to change the value, the parameter immediately jumps to its minimum value and the mouse pointer disappears; when the left mouse button is released.
I've tried versions 1.0, 1.0.9, 1.0.10 and the latest dev, with the same results. There's nothing else that I've seen that doesn't seem to work.
If I run the prepackaged versions it works. So, perhaps something with the java build environment, but it's been downloaded and installed by the build process and there are no complaints about it when building.
Since the prepackaged version (Debian package) works fine, and I don't have problems building on my Debian Jessie machine at home, this is not a big issue, but I thought perhaps someone else had come across it and knew what the problem was.

item.title: Problem adjusting parameters in patcher
item.dc:creator: @ricard Ricard Wanderlof
item.description:
@ricard wrote:

I've encountered a problem with the Axoloti patcher which I have not seen before. I'm trying to run the Axoloti Patcher under Debian Wheezy (because that's what we use at work), building it from source.

I've tried versions 1.0, 1.0.9, 1.0.10 and the latest dev, with the same results. There's nothing else that I've seen that doesn't seem to work.

If I run the prepackaged versions it works. So, perhaps something with the java build environment, but it's been downloaded and installed by the build process and there are no complaints about it when building.
